titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the L. Timothy Portwood Papers
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives
publicationstmt.p: Copyright © 2015 The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior University. All rights reserved.

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Collection largely consists of his files from classes taken at Flintridge Preparatory School, La Canada, California, 1967-72; as an undergraduate at Stanford University, 1972-76; and at the Duke University School of Law, 1976-79. Files include syllabi, exams, class notes, reading notes, and papers. Collection also includes audiocassette and statement regarding his “Patton” speech given in Meyer Library as a Stanford undergraduate, 1976; his application for the California State Bar exam, 1979; and his retirement speech from Stanford, 2008.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: Access: audiocassette may require reformatting prior to use.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: L. Timothy Portwood Papers (SC0966). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: L. Timothy Portwood earned an AB in History at Stanford University in 1976 and his law degree at Duke University. He worked as a lawyer in San Francisco before joining the Development Office at Stanford, where he retired in 2008 as Associate Vice President.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection largely consists of his files from classes taken at Flintridge Preparatory School, La Canada, California, 1967-72; as an undergraduate at Stanford University, 1972-76; and at the Duke University School of Law, 1976-79. Files include syllabi, exams, class notes, reading notes, and papers. Collection also includes audiocassette and statement regarding his “Patton” speech given in Meyer Library as a Stanford undergraduate, 1976; his application for the California State Bar exam, 1979; and his retirement speech from Stanford, 2008.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: Duke University. School of Law. -- General subdivision--Curricula.;

“Five Days in New York City and Two Days Crossing America,” account returning from New York after 9/11 attacks, 2001
